Issues.Title: i18n: No translation found for "id"
Issues.Body:
### Which @angular/* package(s) are the source of the bug? localize ### Is this a regression? No ### Description I am trying to implement runtime translations and am encountering warnings for some strings that state "No translation found for 'id'." I am trying to avoid using custom ids for this project as it is large and I would like to rely on built-in message ids. I am using the command ng extract-i18n --format=xliff2 --out-file src/assets/i18n/translations.en-us.xlf to generate a translation file, which I then convert to JSON using a similar method described in this Github issue: https://github.com/angular/angular/issues/38953. I then use the loadTranslations() method to load the file. My understanding is that when I run ng extract-i18n, the computeDigest() function generates the message id. When the application starts, loadTranslations() calls computeMsgId(), which generates message id in the same format as that rendered to "simple JSON" translation files when extracting messages. However, in my case, the extract generates different ids for the same string in xliff2 vs JSON formats, which is causing the warnings. (Not for all strings, but for some). I have created a JSON object from xliff 2 extracted messages and compared it to the one extracted with JSON, and there were a couple of discrepancies: 1. For the next template: ```html

text {{ test1 }}

text {{ test2 }}

``` xliff2 extractor produced two records, while json extractor created only one record 2. xliff 2 generates a different id compared to JSON for the same string in some cases. I have around 300 differences out of approx. 4500 strings. I looked through closed problems and saw that there was a problem with mapping for xliff 1.2 and some legacy id migration, but I am working with Angular 14 and xliff 2 format so I hoped this shouldn't be a problem anymore... At this stage I can only see 2 solutions to my problem: 1. Using simple JSON format during extract, which is not ideal for the translation team as it doesn't have context implemented. 2. Using custom ids, which I am trying to avoid as it would require another pass through the code base. Could someone please verify that at this stage there is nothing else that can be done? It just seems odd that the ids are different... ### Please provide a link to a minimal reproduction of the bug _No response_ ### Please provide the exception or error you saw ```true template.html:15 No translation found for "7324656422629038198" (" No results found yet. "). ``` ### Please provide the environment you discovered this bug in (run `ng version`) ```true Angular CLI: 14.2.5 Node: 16.18.0 Package Manager: npm 9.2.0 OS: win32 x64 Angular: 14.2.5 ... animations, cli, common, compiler, compiler-cli, core, forms ... language-service, localize, platform-browser ... platform-browser-dynamic, router, service-worker Package Version --------------------------------------------------------- @angular-devkit/architect 0.1402.5 @angular-devkit/build-angular 14.2.5 @angular-devkit/core 14.2.5 @angular-devkit/schematics 14.2.5 @angular/cdk 14.2.4 @angular/material 14.2.4 @schematics/angular 14.2.5 rxjs 7.5.7 typescript 4.8.4 ``` ### Anything else? _No response_

Issues.Title: HashLocationStrategy returns empty string for LocationStrategy.getBasePath()
Issues.Body:
### Which @angular/* package(s) are the source of the bug?

common

### Is this a regression?

No

### Description

When an app is build with `--base-href=/subfolder/` the LocationStrategy behaves inconsistent between `PathLocationStrategy` and `HashLocationStrategy`.
I have an app that is build with above base-href configuration. In it there is an `AppComponent` with the following code to log relevant info:
```ts
export class AppComponent {
  constructor(platformLocation: PlatformLocation, locationStrategy: LocationStrategy) {
    console.log("platformLocation.href:", platformLocation.href);
    console.log("platformLocation.getBaseHrefFromDOM():", platformLocation.getBaseHrefFromDOM());
    console.log("platformLocation.pathname:", platformLocation.pathname);
    console.log("locationStrategy.path():", locationStrategy.path());
    console.log("locationStrategy.getBaseHref():", locationStrategy.getBaseHref());
  }
}
```
If in `AppModule` the RouterModule is imported as `RouterModule.forRoot([])` and I visit `localhost:4200/subfolder/` the following is logged in console:
```
platformLocation.href: http://localhost:4200/subfolder/
platformLocation.getBaseHrefFromDOM(): /subfolder/
platformLocation.pathname: /subfolder/
locationStrategy.path(): /subfolder/
locationStrategy.getBaseHref(): /subfolder/
```
which is what is to be expected. However when RouterModule import is changed to `RouterModule.forRoot([], {useHash: true})` and the same URL is visited, the log is as follows:
```
platformLocation.href: http://localhost:4200/subfolder/
platformLocation.getBaseHrefFromDOM(): /subfolder/
platformLocation.pathname: /subfolder/
locationStrategy.path(): <empty string>
locationStrategy.getBaseHref(): <empty string>
```
Notice that `locationStrategy.getBaseHref()` returns an empty string, when one would expect that it would be `/subfolder/, same as in previous case as the same base-url is configured

### Please provide the environment you discovered this bug in (run `ng version`)

```true
Angular CLI: 15.1.2
Node: 16.19.0
Package Manager: npm 8.19.3
OS: linux x64

Angular packages 15.1.1
```
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "HashLocationStrategy returns empty string for LocationStrategy.getBasePath()" (#48783)

Issues.Title: Bug in ngClass klass property
Issues.Body:
### Which @angular/* package(s) are the source of the bug?

common

### Is this a regression?

No

### Description

The setter of ngClass directive named klass accepts value of type string but transpiled code checks only `null` and not `undefined` on https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/main/packages/common/src/directives/ng_class.ts line 77 (committed 5f21c6d on Dec 9, 2022).

`this.initialClasses = value != null ? value.trim().split(WS_REGEXP) : EMPTY_ARRAY;`

Some libraries (especially PrimeNG) sets the initial value to `undefined` and therefore the app is crashing. Is it possible to check parameter `value` explicitly for string type (like ngClass property)?

`typeof value === 'string' ? value.trim().split(WS_REGEXP) ...`

Thanks in advance.

### Please provide a link to a minimal reproduction of the bug

https://pj-angular-ngclass-setting-bug.stackblitz.io

### Please provide the exception or error you saw

```true

        setInputsForProperty
        setDirectiveInputsWhichShadowsStyling
        checkStylingMap
        classMap
    Overlay_div_0_Template ɵcmp.js:75
    Angular 23
        executeTemplate
```

Issues.Title: $any() type cast function
Issues.Body:
### Describe the problem that you experienced

Normally you try to avoid function/method calls when inside the template (with exception being in the action expression) because angular cannot know for sure the function/method is pure. For that reason it is preferred to use a pipe where one needs to keep it pure or define it is not.

In this documentation the $any() function is called. It is not indicated if this will have any effect on performance, as it seems to have the issue I talk about in the paragraph above. OR is this a "special method" where angular knows it pure and thus has no impact on performance.

### Enter the URL of the topic with the problem

https://angular.io/guide/template-expression-operators#any-type-cast-function

### Describe what you were looking for in the documentation

An indication if (or not) using this method has impact on performance due to it being a method vs. a pipe.

### Describe the actions that led you to experience the problem

Issues.Title: build(docs-infra): convert base64 png images post npm install for StackBlitz
Issues.Body:
- Fixes: https://github.com/angular/angular/issues/48773
- An alternate approach to https://github.com/angular/angular/pull/48774

## PR Type
What kind of change does this PR introduce?

- [x] Bugfix
- [x] Build related changes

## What is the current behavior?
For Stackblitz, following code converts and renames png images:
https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/9e1e5ccdfe1f25a9995f70e3c64ae72551af7562/aio/tools/stackblitz-builder/builder.mjs#L185-L187
StackBlitz's [POST API doesn't support binary images](https://web.archive.org/web/20221208032635/https://developer.stackblitz.com/platform/api/post-api) at the moment.

Due to this deployed code on StackBlitz gets `*.base64.png` files and not original `*.png` files. And all the png images in output are broken.


## What is the new behavior?
On StackBlitz After `npm install` execute postinstall script to convert `*.base64.png` images to binary `*.png` images.
![aio_fix](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/87750369/213465451-911805fb-10fc-4557-8aaf-6da59a9055eb.png)



## Other information

With this approach we can keep using `png` files for the demos, no content change is required.
If StackBlitz POST API starts supporting binary files in future then we simply have to remove the postinstall hook.

## Does this PR introduce a breaking change?

- [ ] Yes
- [x] No
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "build(docs-infra): convert base64 png images post npm install for StackBlitz" (#48776)

Issues.Title: Zone.js unexpected promise callbacks execution order
Issues.Body:
### Which @angular/* package(s) are the source of the bug?

zone.js

### Is this a regression?

No

### Description

The execution order of promise callbacks is not consistent with native behaviour when:

- the promise is created from the `fetch` api
- async/await and promise are mixed

```ts
(async function () {
  const promise = fetch('/');
  promise.then(() => console.log('called first'));
  await promise;
  console.log('called last');
})();
```
Expected output (same as native):
```
called first
called last
```
Actual output:
```
called last
called first
```

By using `Promise.resolve` instead of `fetch`, it behaves as expected.

### Please provide a link to a minimal reproduction of the bug

https://stackblitz.com/edit/zone-playground-vgkwya?file=index.ts

### Please provide the exception or error you saw

_No response_

### Please provide the environment you discovered this bug in (run `ng version`)

```true
cf minimal reproduction, observed with zone.js 0.12.0
```


### Anything else?

Additional explorations: https://stackblitz.com/edit/zone-playground-ddx3mw?file=index.ts
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Zone.js unexpected promise callbacks execution order" (#48767)

Issues.Title: Docs: .png images are broken in StackBlitz live samples
Issues.Body:
### Describe the problem that you experienced

Live samples deployed on StackBlitz have broken `.png` images.

Steps to reproduce:
1. Open page https://angular.io/guide/property-binding
2. Open the live sample link on the page: https://angular.io/generated/live-examples/property-binding/stackblitz.html
3. Let StackBlitz install and run the code
4. In the output you'll see broken images:
![aio_bug](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/87750369/213392513-bb126d26-d45d-49da-b7f7-05f04f2ed79d.png)

I think following code for Plunker still remained in StackBlitz builder, which is causing the issue:
https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/9e1e5ccdfe1f25a9995f70e3c64ae72551af7562/aio/tools/stackblitz-builder/builder.mjs#L185-L187
The code converts and renames all `.png` files. I think all the live samples on StackBlitz show broken images.

### Enter the URL of the topic with the problem

https://angular.io/guide/property-binding

### Describe what you were looking for in the documentation

Live samples working out of the box.

### Describe the actions that led you to experience the problem

Run live samples containing `.png` images on StackBlitz.

### Describe what you want to experience that would fix the problem

Stop converting to base64. These demos need simple images.
The [offline downloadable code](https://angular.io/generated/zips/property-binding/property-binding.zip) uses original normal images.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Docs: .png images are broken in StackBlitz live samples" (#48773)

Issues.Title: build(devtools): fix issue where esbuild configs were not being set properly in DevTools builds
Issues.Body:
Previously, a [createConfig](https://github.com/angular/angular/commit/c841da82c2f97df26184bc06d60c55d0540fd647#diff-52d65d7b28c762ca451e37a01517ed8631f54e98cb1c1887c74ea40ffb7bba3f) helper function was created to consolidate common esbuild configurations for DevTools. This function is asynchronous, but when it was used to set the configuration in various esbuild config files, it was used as if it was synchronous.

This commit fixes this issue by wrapping the output of the function in await, so that it propagates the configurations to esbuild correctly.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "build(devtools): fix issue where esbuild configs were not being set properly in DevTools builds" (#48762)

Issues.Title: Double slash `templateUrls` should not be allowed
Issues.Body:
### Which @angular/* package(s) are the source of the bug? compiler-cli ### Is this a regression? Yes ### Description It is apparently possible to write a component using a leading `//` in a `templateUrl` like so: ```typescript // path/to/my/component/my-component.ts @Component({ selector: 'my-component', templateUrl: '//path/to/my/component/my-component.html', }) class MyComponent {} ``` ```html
Hello, World!
``` This shouldn't be allowed as it's not a valid path. In particular this looks like a Bazel path, which makes it seem intentional when it really isn't. @devversion [investigated this](https://github.com/angular/components/pull/19320#discussion_r435515440) a little while ago, and it does seem to be unintentionally supported. There are a handful of usages in google3, but mostly in experimental directories. It likely would not be a difficult migration. We should also clean up [this code path](http://go/build-cleaner-ngc-leading-slashes) in Build Cleaner. ### Please provide a link to a minimal reproduction of the bug _No response_ ### Please provide the exception or error you saw _No response_ ### Please provide the environment you discovered this bug in (run `ng version`) _No response_ ### Anything else? _No response_

Issues.Title: docs(docs-infra): put prerequisites page 'guide/property-binding' before 'guide/attribute-binding'
Issues.Body:
Pages [guide/attribute-binding](https://angular.io/guide/attribute-binding#prerequisites) and [guide/class-binding](https://angular.io/guide/class-binding#prerequisites) have prerequisite of [guide/property-binding](https://angular.io/guide/property-binding) but in navigation the property binding page comes much later. The change puts the binding pages in prerequisite order.

Issues.Title: provideRouter: there is no option for `errorHandler`
Issues.Body:
### Which @angular/* package(s) are relevant/related to the feature request?

router

### Description

This is a followup of #48295.

There is no replacement for ExtraOptions with new `provideRouter`
eg

```
RouterModule.forRoot(APPLICATION_ROUTES, {
        errorHandler: (error: any) => console.error('Router Error Occured', error)
      }),
```

The linked issue mentioned you can use the Router.events with NavigationError but this is not usable for all variants of handling navigation errors.
The defaultErrorHandler is throwing the error and can't be overwritten:

https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/61e69c87e6b577f1c5a71fb5c39c3bd6125c4b91/packages/router/src/router.ts#L169-L171

https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/61e69c87e6b577f1c5a71fb5c39c3bd6125c4b91/packages/router/src/router.ts#L977-L987

For the moment the best way is to use an own provide for the ROUTER_CONFIG injection token.

### Proposed solution

Add new settings to Router config

```
 provideRouter(APPLICATION_ROUTES, withRouterConfig({
        errorHandler: (error: any) => console.error('Router Error Occured', error)
    })),
```

### Alternatives considered

There is non if you want to fluent API.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "provideRouter: there is no option for `errorHandler`" (#48759)

#### Using Bzlmod with Bazel 6:

1.  Enable with `common --enable_bzlmod` in `.bazelrc`.
2.  Add to your `MODULE.bazel` file:

```starlark
bazel_dep(name = "aspect_bazel_lib", version = "1.23.3")
```

> Read more about bzlmod: <https://blog.aspect.dev/bzlmod>

#### Using WORKSPACE

Paste this snippet into your  file:

```starlark
load("@​bazel_tools//tools/build_defs/repo:http.bzl", "http_archive")

http_archive(
    name = "aspect_bazel_lib",
    sha256 = "79623d656aa23ad3fd4692ab99786c613cd36e49f5566469ed97bc9b4c655f03",
    strip_prefix = "bazel-lib-1.23.3",
    url = "https://github.com/aspect-build/bazel-lib/archive/refs/tags/v1.23.3.tar.gz",
)

load("@​aspect_bazel_lib//lib:repositories.bzl", "aspect_bazel_lib_dependencies")

aspect_bazel_lib_dependencies()

```

register_yq_toolchains()

Issues.Title: Angular is not accepting special character inside a string type query parameter
Issues.Body:
### Which @angular/* package(s) are relevant/related to the feature request?

_No response_

### Description

I have an API `that` needs a string-type query parameter i.e.  `http://localhost:8282/api/task/T#0000007427`.
However, angular is parsing this API call as  `http://localhost:8282/api/task/T` only.



### Proposed solution

It has to accept the string as a whole string, which is  `http://localhost:8282/api/task/T#0000007427`

### Alternatives considered

.....

bazel_dep(name = "aspect_bazel_lib", version = "1.23.3")
```

> Read more about bzlmod: <https://blog.aspect.dev/bzlmod>

#### Using WORKSPACE

Paste this snippet into your  file:

```starlark
load("@​bazel_tools//tools/build_defs/repo:http.bzl", "http_archive")

http_archive(
    name = "aspect_bazel_lib",
    sha256 = "79623d656aa23ad3fd4692ab99786c613cd36e49f5566469ed97bc9b4c655f03",
    strip_prefix = "bazel-lib-1.23.3",

)

### [`v0.17.3`](https://togithub.com/evanw/esbuild/blob/HEAD/CHANGELOG.md#​0173)

[Compare Source](https://togithub.com/evanw/esbuild/compare/v0.17.2...v0.17.3)

-   Fix incorrect CSS minification for certain rules ([#​2838](https://togithub.com/evanw/esbuild/issues/2838))

    Certain rules such as `@media` could previously be minified incorrectly. Due to a typo in the duplicate rule checker, two known `@`-rules that share the same hash code were incorrectly considered to be equal. This problem was made worse by the rule hashing code considering two unknown declarations (such as CSS variables) to have the same hash code, which also isn't optimal from a performance perspective. Both of these issues have been fixed:

    ```css
    /* Original input */
    @​media (prefers-color-scheme: dark) { body { --VAR-1: #​000; } }
    @​media (prefers-color-scheme: dark) { body { --VAR-2: #​000; } }

    /* Old output (with --minify) */
    @​media (prefers-color-scheme: dark){body{--VAR-2: #​000}}

    /* New output (with --minify) */
    @​media (prefers-color-scheme: dark){body{--VAR-1: #​000}}@​media (prefers-color-scheme: dark){body{--VAR-2: #​000}}
    ```

</details>

Issues.Title: fix(@angular-devkit/build-angular): avoid undefined module path for Sass imports in esbuild
Issues.Body: When using Sass with the experimental esbuild-based browser application builder, bare imports without a path segment that were available via included paths but also happen to be a node module could cause an exception. An example of such an import would be `@import "globals";`. The deep import node module logic would previously attempt to join an undefined path segment to the resolved path for the `globals` package which would raise a argument type exception. This case has now been fixed by only joining if there is actually a path segment present such as `@import "globals/x"`. With this fix in place, the node module case can then continue and if no stylesheet is found, the include paths will then be searched.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "fix(@angular-devkit/build-angular): avoid undefined module path for Sass imports in esbuild" (#24569)

Issues.Title: Configurable environment settings
Issues.Body:
### Which @angular/* package(s) are relevant/related to the feature request?

_No response_

### Description

There is a nice ability in angular to define multiple environments and have a different build per each of them.
The only problem is that environment file is NOT configurable on prod but there are settings need that ability for us, 
for example: "serverApiUrl" which we need to be configurable on prod.

So, in addition to what we have today, we need an ability to define configurable settings according to the environment used.

### Proposed solution

various options i can think about:

- enable defining configurable properties in environment files
- enable creating a config file per environment and using it in code like environment with file replace in angular.json like environment


### Alternatives considered

currently we can create a "configFile" property in all environments, but all those files are assets, so all of them are deployed during CI\CD although a specific environment has been built.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Configurable environment settings" (#24578)

### Description

When restarting xxx, when some entries were already entered in the configuration files - in the case of app.modules.ts, the CLI detects the BrowserModule and adds .withServerTransition({ appId: 'serverApp' })
It doesn't check if it was there before and as a result it is created

Issues.Title: fix(@schematics/angular): replace existing `BrowserModule.withServerTransition` calls when running universal schematic
Issues.Body:
This change fixes an issue where calling the universal schematic on an application with existing `BrowserModule.withServerTransition` will cause an additional `.withServerTransition` call to be added.

With this change we now remove the previous `withServerTransition` call to avoid misconfiguration.

Closes #24563
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "fix(@schematics/angular): replace existing `BrowserModule.withServerTransition` calls when running universal schematic" (#24564)

Issues.Title: refactor(@angular-devkit/build-angular): use esbuild 0.17 incremental API in esbuild builder
Issues.Body: Due to the update of the experimental esbuild-based browser application builder to use esbuild 0.17, the watch mode has been changed to use the new incremental API. The previous API has been removed from esbuild. The new API involves creating a build context object that can then be used to perform rebuilds of the configured application bundler as needed. All watch mode usage has been updated to use this new approach. An effort was made to minimize the amount of changes made to support this API update and limit the changeset. However, further refactoring will be possible as additional capabilities are added in the future.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "refactor(@angular-devkit/build-angular): use esbuild 0.17 incremental API in esbuild builder" (#24561)

Issues.Title: Allow ng serve to listen on unix socket
Issues.Body:
### Command

serve

### Description

I'm working on multiple project and playing around with ports to avoid conflict, or being force to stop a project to start a new one is annoying, I would like to be able to start `ng serve` on an unix socket (Also [available on windows](https://batsov.com/articles/2022/01/20/unix-sockets-are-now-supported-on-windows))
This would allow me to dispatch through nginx to the expected project based on the domain name (I added domain in my `/etc/hosts` file)

A nice things is that the ports are not an issue anymore, I only need nginx to listen on 80/443 and then I don't have to find a new unused port for each project.

### Describe the solution you'd like

Allow `--host` syntax like `unix:///var/run/angular-serve.sock`

### Describe alternatives you've considered

_No response_
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Allow ng serve to listen on unix socket" (#24562)

Issues.Title: fix(@angular-devkit/build-angular): prevent hanging initial build during exception with esbuild
Issues.Body: When using the experimental esbuild-based browser application builder and an exception is thrown during the initial build, the process may hang indefinitely due to the Sass worker pool not shutting down fully. This does not happen for rebuilds after the initial.  To remedy this situation, The initial build is now wrapped in a try block to ensure that a full shutdown of the Sass worker pool occurs.

Issues.Title: docs-bug(MatCellHarness): getColumnName returns the name, but altered
Issues.Body:
### Documentation Feedback

The description of `MatCellHarness.getColumnName()` states that it

> Gets the name of the column that the cell belongs to.

What it DOESN'T say is that if the column name has any symbols in it like dots or backslashes or anything that the [_setNameInput method in CdkColumnDef](https://github.com/angular/components/blob/623b0c94e90f83ba1a91d93137ebad6622e12bdd/src/cdk/table/cell.ts#L139) would consider not CSS friendly, the harness will instead return that column's name with all of the offending characters replaced with dashes

**Example:** 

Let's say that I've defined row template as [per point 3 in MatTable's Getting Started](https://material.angular.io/components/table/overview#3-define-the-row-templates) section, and one of the columns is called _"bar.tar"_

`columnsToDisplay = ['foo', 'bar.tar'];`

Later on I'm writing tests and using test harnesses to get a list of that table's columns

```
// cells is of type MatCellHarness[]
const columnNames = await parallel(() => cells.map(cell => cell.getColumnName()));
// columnNames is ['foo', 'bar-tar']
```

As I understand, it's because the cell harness uses the [cell's own CSS class](https://github.com/angular/components/blob/31a754c90405ac3a21858cdd038d56aa7375fabc/src/material/table/testing/cell-harness.ts#L23) to deduct its column's name, which is fair enough, but I do strongly think that this behaviour should be documented


### Affected documentation page

https://material.angular.io/components/table/api#MatCellHarness
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "docs-bug(MatCellHarness): getColumnName returns the name, but altered" (#26462)

Issues.Title: bug(mat-menu): Scrollbar appears for sub-menu at given positions
Issues.Body:
### Is this a regression?

- [ ] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

_No response_

### Description

To reproduce the problem, open the mat-menu [documentation/examples](https://material.angular.io/components/menu/examples).

Sometimes the sub-menu receives a scrollbar instead of positioning it in a way that it does not require any scrolling. It has to do something with the additional 8px padding and translating.

By changing the `.mat-menu-panel` height to `fit-content` the issues is solved, however it's not a bullet-proof solution.

### Reproduction

Steps to reproduce:
1. Open the mat-menu [documentation/examples](https://material.angular.io/components/menu/examples).
1. "Restore Down" the browser so you can change its height easily
2. Open the submenu
3. Decrease the height of the browser in a way that the bottom of the window approaches the bottom of the sub-menu
4. In a given interval the sub-menu has a scrollbar


### Expected Behavior

The sub-menu should be sized and positioned properly so it does not have a scrollbar.

### Actual Behavior

In a given position/interval the sub-menu has a scrollbar.

### Environment

Angular CLI: 14.2.1
Node: 14.17.5
Package Manager: npm 7.24.2 
OS: win32 x64
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "bug(mat-menu): Scrollbar appears for sub-menu at given positions" (#26460)

Issues.Title: bug(MatSlider): Slider thumb's center moves depending on the selected value
Issues.Body:
### Is this a regression?

- [ ] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

_No response_

### Description

Slider thumb's center moves either left or right depending on which edge of the slider the selected value is closer to. 

The second mark on the left:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/115452783/213394851-52907bd5-74ec-4bcf-b226-50541dce0936.png)

The second mark on the right:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/115452783/213395360-cb7bca79-4d47-480c-946a-ac3a831806bf.png)

You can see how thumb's ripple has moved relative to the neighbour marks on the slider track. The closer to the edge of the slider you are, the bigger this shift is. 

Slider has changed significantly in version 15 so I'm not sure if this should be considered a regression.

### Reproduction

Steps to reproduce:
1. Open StackBlitz example: https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-la9j4m?file=src%2Fapp%2Fslider-formatting-example.html
2. Focus the second mark on the left
3. Focus the second mark on the right
4. Compare the thumb ripple positions relative to neighbour marks


### Expected Behavior

Slider's thumb should be positioned correctly regardless of which value is selected on the slider track.

### Actual Behavior

Slider's thumb moves either left or right depending on which edge of the slider the selected value is closer to. 

### Environment

- Angular: 15.0.4
- CDK/Material: 15.1.1
- Browser(s): Chrome
- Operating System: macOS
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "bug(MatSlider): Slider thumb's center moves depending on the selected value" (#26459)

Issues.Title: feat(all): Support for CSS Cascade Layers
Issues.Body:
### Feature Description

Are there any plans to introduce support for CSS Cascade Layers?

References: 
https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Learn/CSS/Building_blocks/Cascade_layers
https://caniuse.com/css-cascade-layers
https://www.smashingmagazine.com/2022/01/introduction-css-cascade-layers/

### Use Case

To meet the demands of our customers, our team often has to override the default styles of angular material components. We'd like to use cascade layers to organize our normalization, override, and custom styles. If the angular components would be wrapped in a dedicated (configurable?) layer, our material overrides could be embedded more conveniently into our overall style logic.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "feat(all): Support for CSS Cascade Layers" (#26451)

Issues.Title: docs-bug(THEME): Is it ok to use mat.$private-dark-primary-text?
Issues.Body:
### Documentation Feedback

I'm upgrading to v15, and need access to $dark-primary-text to setup my theme. Previously I would import it via `@angular/material/theming as mat` and then use mat.$dark-primary-text. 

With v15, ```mat``` is imported via `@use '@angular/material' as mat`, and dark-primary-text is available via mat.$private-dark-primary-text. 

What is the recommended approach to get access to the dark-primary-text color? Should we continue to import @angular/material/theming or is this considered legacy at this point? 

Better documentation to support migrating to the new theme API is needed overall. 

### Affected documentation page

https://material.angular.io/guide/theming
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "docs-bug(THEME): Is it ok to use mat.$private-dark-primary-text? " (#26439)

Issues.Title: Chip harness editing support
Issues.Body:
Includes a couple of commits necessary to support editing a chip row through harnesses.

The first commit adds a `setText` method to `TestElement`. It is required, because the chip's edit input is a `contenteditable` span and we currently don't have a way of setting its text.

The second commit adds `startEditing` and `finishEditing` methods to the chip row harness, as well as a `MatChipEditInputHarness` to support the entire editing flow in a test.

Fixes https://github.com/angular/components/issues/26419.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "Chip harness editing support" (#26442)

_No response_

### Description

The documentation for the stepper appears to indicate that this should not be occurring based on the role for the stepper being a tablist and the roles for steps being tab. I think the problem comes from some interim nodes between the tabs and the tablist.

### Reproduction

Steps to reproduce:
1.  navigate to the material stepper examples page: https://rc.material.angular.io/components/stepper/examples
2. run a scan of it using the axe def tool chrome extension: https://chrome.google.com/webstore/detail/axe-devtools-web-accessib/lhdoppojpmngadmnindnejefpokejbdd?hl=en-US
3.  You will see that it will result in 14 instances of the error "Certain ARIA roles must contain particular children". That is one for each stepper on the example page.


### Expected Behavior

Running the WCAG2.1 AA compliance scan should not find the "Certain ARIA roles must contain particular children" issue which is considered a critical aria issue.

### Actual Behavior

Running the WCAG2.1 AA compliance scan finds the "Certain ARIA roles must contain particular children" issue which is considered a critical aria issue.

There is no clear way to resolve this issue with the stepper component.

### Environment

- Angular: 15
- CDK/Material: 15.1.0
- Browser(s): Chrome
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): Windows

Issues.Title: bug(Theming): dark theme input labels are hard to read with the built-in custom theme template
Issues.Body:
### Is this a regression?

- [ ] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

Not sure if present or not, it's in 15.0 and 15.1, I did not check older versions.

### Description

Input and select boxes are given a brighter background ("on-surface" color) using a focus overlay div when you hover or focus them. The resulting background color is a light gray. This can make some label text colors more difficult to read than necessary including the default custom theme set up by the ng add setup script for @angular/material.

Oddly enough if I enable auto dark mode in Chrome's flags it decides to change this white background into a black one which looks much better (this is what initially sent me on this rabbit hole because I forgot it was on and doing things as it does).

### Reproduction

https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-ivy-mftvsq

Material docs site has the same problem; focus either input field in the first example while using either of the provided dark themes:

https://material.angular.io/components/input/overview

I first reproduced using the command line tools:

Steps to reproduce:
1. ng new <project> (no routing)
2. cd <project>
3. ng add @angular/material (custom theme, enable animations)
4. change the theme to dark mode in styles.scss.
5. add mat input and mat form field modules to app.module.ts
6. add a mat input to app.component which uses a mat-label.
7. ng serve and check it out


### Expected Behavior

The label should remain readable while the input is focused.

IMO the focus overlay for input/select/textarea should be less opaque white or should be black ("surface" color?) instead to avoid lowering contrast with text color. Not sure if light theme needs adjustment as well, I think it was more readable.

Alternatively the label and underline should be white instead of primary color for maximum readability.

I don't know what the material guidelines have to say about this if anything.

### Actual Behavior

The text is difficult to read while the input is focused as the background becomes a light gray and the label color is primary.

### Environment

- Angular: 15.1.0
- CDK/Material: 15.1.0
- Browser(s): Chrome 111.0.5532.2 and 108.0.5359.126
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu):  Windows 11 22H2 and Windows 10 21H2
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "bug(Theming): dark theme input labels are hard to read with the built-in custom theme template" (#26441)

Issues.Title: bug(cdk-drag-drop, cdk-tree): FireFox (mouseenter) not working with cdkDrag
Issues.Body:
### Is this a regression?

- [ ] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

_No response_

### Description

## Different behavior with cdkDrag and  (mouseenter) between Chrome and Firefox

```
        <cdk-nested-tree-node *cdkTreeNodeDef="let node" 
                              (mouseenter)="onMouseEnter(node)" (mouseleave)="onMouseLeave(node)">
            <div
                    cdkDrag
                    (cdkDragStarted)="dragStarted()" (cdkDragEnded)="dragEnded()"
                    (cdkDragDropped)="dragDropped()"
                    (click)="selectEntity(node)"
            >
```


### Chrome: (mouseenter) event is triggered successfully, after (cdkDragStarted)


![Chrome](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/122812012/212735599-6cd192e4-c6a1-4750-b038-36f1e03524a8.gif)


### Firefox: same logic fails


![FireFox](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/122812012/212735793-b76e86e6-191f-4727-9394-ab3ac554394e.gif)


### Reproduction

Steps to reproduce:
1. Create `<cdk-tree>` structure inside Angular app
2. Add `(mouseenter)` to `<cdk-nested-tree-node>`
3. Inside `<cdk-nested-tree-node>` add `<div>` with `cdkDrag` directive
4. Compare behavior between Chrome and FireFox


### Expected Behavior

Should be same

### Actual Behavior

Firefox: Failed `(mouseenter)` event execution

Event not triggering after `(cdkDragStarted)`

### Environment

- Angular: 10.2.7
- CDK/Material: 10.2.7 
- Browser(s): Chrome  108.0.5359.124, FireFox 108.0.1 
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): Windows, Fedora
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "bug(cdk-drag-drop, cdk-tree): FireFox (mouseenter) not working with cdkDrag" (#26440)

Issues.Title: bug(mat-table): Wrong row height for flex
Issues.Body:
### Is this a regression?

- [ ] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

_No response_

### Description

I'm just checking the new MDC guidline / changelog and was wondering why in the [demo](https://material.angular.io/components/table/examples#table-flex-basic) the new row height (52px) was missing for the flex table. 

This is because the height is reset here https://github.com/angular/components/blob/main/src/material/table/_table-flex-styles.scss#L3 to (the old) 48px but if I'm not mistaken the value needs to be 52px (or gets picked from the original style)?

Btw. the same is for padding. The flex table overrides the expected default values from MDC.

### Reproduction

Flex-Table of the example does not have the new height:

https://material.angular.io/components/table/examples#table-flex-basic

### Expected Behavior

Using flex / html table should not make a difference in row height?

### Actual Behavior

Flex / Html table differ in row height ...?

### Environment

- Angular: 15.0.3
- CDK/Material: 15.0.2
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "bug(mat-table): Wrong row height for flex" (#26438)

Issues.Title: bug(mat-tab): content is not scrolling while dragging a list item inside material tab with height 100%
Issues.Body:
### Is this a regression?

- [ ] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

_No response_

### Description

If I drag a list item put inside a tab with height 100%, the content will not scroll.
The same configuration works if the tab height is auto, but in that case the tabs will scroll outside the viewport.

### Reproduction

Steps to reproduce:
1. Add a draggable material list (cdkDropList) inside a material tab
2. Set mat-tab-group height to 100% to make the tab content scrolls
3. Drag a list item until scrolling needed


https://stackblitz.com/edit/components-issue-sn5cvq?file=src/main.ts

### Expected Behavior

I'd like the tab content scrolls like when the mat-tab-group height is auto.

### Actual Behavior

The tab content doesn't scroll as expected.

### Environment

- Angular: 15.0.0
- CDK/Material: 15.0.0
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "bug(mat-tab): content is not scrolling while dragging a list item inside material tab with height 100%" (#26437)
